summary: This is an internal email from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY) discussing a request to obtain grand jury materials from the original Epstein case from the Southern District of Florida (SDFL). The email debates the appropriate protocol for contacting the Criminal Division chief in SDFL to secure consent for sharing the materials under Rule 6(e).

events.title: SDNY Request for SDFL Grand Jury Materials
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York discusses obtaining consent from the Southern District of Florida to receive all grand jury materials from the original Epstein case, citing Rule 6(e) which permits sharing between federal grand juries.

keyFacts: The FBI in Florida requested that SDNY obtain consent from SDFL to turn over all grand jury materials from the original Epstein case.
SDNY had previously obtained some files from the original case without SDFL raising the issue, but SDFL has now raised it.
Sharing grand jury material between different federal grand juries is specifically approved under Federal Rule of Criminal Procedure 6(e).
The email debates whether SDNY should contact the SDFL Criminal Division chief directly or have the Office of the Deputy Attorney General (ODAG) coordinate the request.
The correspondence indicates ongoing investigative or prosecutorial activity related to Jeffrey Epstein in April 2019, prior to his arrest in July 2019.
